pullRequest.body:
We allow the indexing category for the cofiltered limit in the result `Profinite.exists_locallyConstant` to live in a smaller universe than our profinite sets.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body: Since #8556 was merged, we should be able to state more general inequalities (not just `v ≤ max u v`): it should be possible to use the new `UnivLE.{v, u}` instead (which really means `v ≤ u`). @alreadydone may have more precise suggestions about this. (Is the rest of the limits API ready for this application to profinite sets, or are some more refactor necessary?)

Given `UnivLE.{v, u}` Lean still doesn't seem to regard `Type (max v u)` and `Type u` as the same thing. In the API for limits in `Type*` there is some `equivShrink` business to deal with this and I'm not sure we have the API to do that in categories of topological spaces. AFAIK there is no `homeoShrink`?

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7045496017/job/19175345060)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7045496017/job/19175344804)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7045496017/job/19175345304)
This PR is an improvement: we shall fix the global universe inequalities issues later...
This PR is an improvement: we shall fix the global universe inequalities issues later...

```suggestion
* Define procategories and prove that `Profinite` is equivalent to `Pro (FintypeCat)`.
```

```suggestion
Many definitions involving universe inequalities in Mathlib are expressed through use of `max u v`. Unfortunately,
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion Many definitions involving universe inequalities in Mathlib are expressed through use of `max u v`. ```

Sorry, totally missed the review request. The PR looks good to me.

I tried a bit to switch to UnivLE, and indeed to fix this we need something like `homeoShrink` in [TopCat.limitConeInfi](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Category/TopCat/Limits/Basic.html#TopCat.limitConeInfi). For different categories we need to put multitudes of structures on `Shrink`, which is not ideal but doable (see how we added tons of algebraic and order instances on type synonyms). I think I'd like to go further with my idea of shrinking the indexing category `J` rather than the limit object in the category, and I'd start with refactoring [CategoryTheory.Limits.Types.Small.limitCone](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Limits/Types.html#CategoryTheory.Limits.Types.Small.limitCone). I think with proper APIs (maybe utilizing EqToHom), we can avoid descending into dependent hell.
Your suggested change to `hB` is already there in the latest commit. Maybe you were reviewing an older commit?

Not sure what you're referring to? I only discovered this PR yesterday and certainly did not review any older commits. I'm just pointing out the first place that need to be fixed to switch to UnivLE, not asking you to change anything.
Never mind, I read the red and green above as you suggesting a change but it's actually my change.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Profinite): allow more universe flexibility in Profinite/CofilteredLimit

nodes.body: Since #8556 was merged, we should be able to state more general inequalities (not just `v ≤ max u v`): it should be possible to use the new `UnivLE.{v, u}` instead (which really means `v ≤ u`). @alreadydone may have more precise suggestions about this. (Is the rest of the limits API ready for this application to profinite sets, or are some more refactor necessary?)

Given `UnivLE.{v, u}` Lean still doesn't seem to regard `Type (max v u)` and `Type u` as the same thing. In the API for limits in `Type*` there is some `equivShrink` business to deal with this and I'm not sure we have the API to do that in categories of topological spaces. AFAIK there is no `homeoShrink`?
This PR is an improvement: we shall fix the global universe inequalities issues later...
